intro: Morinda ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf morinda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink and are clustered in inflorescences. Morinda ligulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
